Quotes: A boy's story is the best that is ever told.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: In the little world in which children have their existence, whosoever brings them up, there is nothing so finely perceived and so finely felt, as injustice.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: Happy, happy Christmas, that can win us back to the delusions of our childhood days, recall to the old man the pleasures of his youth, and transport the traveler back to his own fireside and quiet home!
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: To be ignorant of what occurred before you were born is to remain always a child.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: To be a successful father... there's one absolute rule: when you have a kid, don't look at it for the first two years.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: In every real man a child is hidden that wants to play.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: My mother loved children - she would have given anything if I had been one.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: The place is very well and quiet and the children only scream in a low voice.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: The most interesting information comes from children, for they tell all they know and then stop.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: I am not young enough to know everything.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Every child is an artist. The problem is how to remain an artist once we grow up.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: We ought to esteem it of the greatest importance that the fictions which children first hear should be adapted in the most perfect manner to the promotion of virtue.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Let parents bequeath to their children not riches, but the spirit of reverence.
Author: Plato

Quotes: No one ever keeps a secret so well as a child.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: Children wish fathers looked but with their eyes;fathers that children with their judgment looked;and either may be wrong.
Author: William Shakespeare
